text.p: Argentina is eyeing the sterling sector, syndicate sources said on Friday.
A seven to 10-year institutionally-targeted bond was mooted, they said.
"They're looking at a deal longer than five years," a syndicate source said, "But I don't think they'll rush into a decision."
Dealers said a mandate to lead manage the transaction could be announced next week.
Argentina has only once tapped the sterling sector with a 100 million stg five-year bond via SBC Warburg in July last year.
It was lauched to yield 390 basis points over gilts and has tightened to trade at around 211 b.p. over.
The paper pays a coupon of 11.50 percent.
Mexico recently tapped the sterling sector with a 300 million five-year deal launched at 175 b.p. over gilts and is still holding at around those levels, dealers said.
BZW and SBC Warburg were joint lead managers of the transaction.
The paper pays a coupon of 8.75 percent.
